title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Governance - Senior Business Data Steward

Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.

Role name and description

Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.

We are looking for a Senior Business Data Steward to join our Global Data Governance function. Your creativity will be challenged daily to design and build various data quality solutions to enable strategic business goals.

The opportunity

As part of the Data Governance Team, you will be responsible for identifying and understanding business issues. Closely collaborate with both business stakeholders, including leadership, as well as development teams to provide solutions that enable the business to maintain efficient operations and meet compliance objectives. Be the primary quality control analyst for the management of Critical Data Elements (CDEs).

Your... key responsibilities
• Identify key/critical elements that require governance based on priority and impact assessments
• Promote awareness and ownership of data assets – establish relations
• Establish and define data standards, definitions, and rules
• Document data flow, process, and controls
• Develop, implement and improve data management procedures
• Analyse and design KPIs and data quality metrics to detect and prioritize issues
• Analyse, design, and implement remediation procedures including cleansing, process, and system enhancements.

Skills and attributes for success
• Proactively identify key/critical data elements associated with business issues
• Design, implement and enhance data profiling, modelling, and integration solutions
• Understand business issues and risks from process and controls, data management, and system integration perspectives
• Mature people and stakeholder management skills that enable ongoing mitigation of risks associated with key data elements

To qualify for the role, you must have
• Core competencies in Data Analytics / Data Governance / Master Data Management
• Analyse, design, and implement remediation procedures to improve data quality, and enhance data flow and system controls
• Mastery level including 7 years’ experience in:
• Data Profiling and Modelling using recognized tools / protocols
• Data Integration and denormalization
• Data Analytics
• MS SQL Query Skills

Ideally, you’ll also have
• Knowledge of SAP, PeopleSoft, other ERP data models and operations
• Experience in Data Quality Analysis, Cleansing and Conversion projects

What we look for

We are looking for a Senior Business Data Steward with solid experience in analytics and business impact assessments to take responsibility for quality of critical data assets.

What we offer

EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
• Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
• Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
• Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
• Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

About EY

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build

title: Data Analyst - Gamma Retail Catalyst
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

BCG is seeking a Data Analyst, based in Warsaw, Poland. You will join the rapidly growing Retail Catalyst team, which helps build and implement advanced analytics software for our Retail case teams and clients. Retail Catalyst is part of BCG GAMMA, BCG’s data science and software products business unit. The Warsaw-based team is in charge of building, configuring, and delivering world-class analytics software and apps.

In particular, you will be in charge of:
• Supporting the Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to deliver excellent and seamless client delivery service
• Rapidly take responsibility for expanding / improving use cases and help our clients achieve their analytics goals
• Developing, customizing, and performance-tuning Tableau dashboards
• Building and maintaining ETL flows in Dataiku
• Overseeing and executing client data ingestion and data quality control
• Performing analytics to support the software / apps and generating insights
• Providing technical... solution and domain expertise to our clients and case teams
• Coordinating with clients / case teams and maintaining a close sync with our engineering, data science, and devops teams
• Proactively collecting and incorporating client and case team feedback to make the Retail Catalyst platform the best it can be
• Over time, become a leader of the Warsaw Retail Catalyst team and take on management responsibility

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
The Data Analyst will have two major areas of responsibilities:
Client Service (80%)
• Support onsite Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to successfully deliver Retail Catalyst projects
• Work directly with clients, BCG case teams, and product team on a project-by-project basis to conduct hands-on rigorous quantitative analysis, leveraging advanced analysis software (e.g., Dataiku and Tableau for visualization)
• Ingest, clean, transform, maintain, and analyze client data on Retail Catalyst platform
• Rapidly configure standard and custom Tableau dashboards per CSM, client, and case team’s directions / requirements
• Oversee and quality-control all things ETL and Tableau for our client deployments
• Coordinate the Warsaw delivery team to provide world-class quality output and hyper-responsive client service
Product and IP development (20%)
• Maintain library of client-agnostic Tableau dashboards and ETL flows
• Improve setup and preparation of standard / starting point components so that they can be rapidly deployed and configured for client use cases
• Support Retail Catalyst product team in client development efforts with ad hoc analysis, problem solving on best analytical approach, and client demos
• Study and understand Retail sector terminology and industry (analytics-) knowledge
• Over time, identify new areas of application/use cases for Retail Catalyst and help embed these into the platform and apps
Your success in this role will be measured in your ability to support our clients and case teams with highly responsive and top quality outputs. You will also be measured on your level of proactivity in terms of improving and expanding the technical platforms and analytical use cases. Finally, we will expect you to, over time, take responsibility for the Warsaw team, including development and mentorship for junior team members and overall quality control
YOU'RE GOOD AT

Technical skills
• Tableau (Advanced / World class)
• ETL / SQL (Advanced / World class)
• Excel (Advanced)
• Statistics and math (Intermediate)
• Python knowledge is a plus
• Data automation knowledge (e.g., Airflow) is a plus
• Cloud knowledge (Google Cloud and Azure) is a plus

Non-technical skills
• Meticulous attention to detail
• Highly efficient – you get a lot of work done in very little time
• Willingness to work hard and prioritize team success vs. regular working hours
• Highly proactive and strong drive for (self-) improvement
• Dedicated team player
• Excellent communication skills in English
• World class problem-solving skills
• Self-motivated and is able to operate autonomously in a structured manner
• Ability to coach others
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

Education or Certifications
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, data science / statistics, or business administration

Work Experience
• Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in Tableau, including Tableau server tuning, Tableau APIs, Hyper, recent and upcoming product innovations, etc.
• Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in ETL for very large data sets (terabyte+)
• Deep expertise in SQL, ideally PostgreSQL
• Experience in conducting thorough quality checks on ETL flows
• Experience with data ingestion and automation of ingestion is a big plus
• Experience with visualized ETL tools (Alteryx, Dataiku) is a big plus
• Experience in working with global teams
• Client service experience is a plus
• Cloud platform experience is a plus
YOU'LL WORK WITH

• Client success team
• Tableau delivery team
• Devops team
• Product engineering and platform team
• Commercial and product leadership

description:

title: Master Data Analyst
description:
Marel is new in town and very excited to establish its Shared Services Center in Lodz! Marel is a highly innovative international company that is transforming the way food is processed. Now we want to transform the way we do Finance in the company. We are looking for highly motivated individuals to join our team and embark on this journey with us. We will build a diverse team of specialists that together form a united team, striving for excellence. Are you proud of what you did today? Our people are. Join us and help to drive the changes!

To support Master Data team, we are looking for a driven candidate who will be responsible for analyzing, maintaining and cleansing Master Data accurately in our systems to ensure high quality Master Data in support of operational processes. Does the prospect of working in an international environment with a competent and fun team appeal to you? Go for it, and apply for:

Master Data Analyst

What you’ll be doing
• Responsible for quality of master... data, performing correct data entry into a system, maintaining this data and supporting data cleansing for both business, global and local master data teams. This can be executed in different focus areas and systems in Marel, some examples: Norm parts in PLM, vendors & customers in related systems, global data like customs, planning and classifications
• Act on business requests, validating the requests before updating data in systems, according to the service level agreement
• Linking pin between relevant departments; and other business units to solve issues, improve data quality and project execution
• Understand master data management and uphold global master data standards, processes and guidelines to requestors and other stakeholders
• Align with internal and external stakeholders directly where this is required
• Actively drive global cooperation, harmonization and continuous improvement initiatives
• Develop work instructions, process descriptions and training material

About you
• 2-5 years working experience in the area of Master Data or Data Analytics
• Experience in handling master data and/or data analytics on a regular basis is strongly preferred.
• Proven stakeholder management skills in an international environment with a multi-cultural, multi-discipline organization.
• Advanced level computer proficiency and experience with relevant tooling
• Strong focus on quality and high level of accuracy in daily work
• Result driven, keeping the agreed service level in mind
• Ability to analyze data, recognize deviations, with exceptional attention to detail

We offer

We offer you the opportunity to develop yourself. This starts on you first day. You will receive an extensive, well-prepared onboarding period, followed by a function-specific development track of one year. You will be guided by our organization and an experienced coworker, that will teach you the specialist knowledge of our advanced equipment. On an annual basis, you will create a personal development plan so your professional and personal development are always top of mind. Our informal culture offers you the opportunity to take your own responsibilities and show initiatives.

Interested?

Are you interested in this challenging new position? Please apply via the Apply Button on our website and upload your resume. For more information about the position, contact Kasia Strzelczyk-Kus, Talent Acquisition Specialist. E-mail:

To find out more about our organization, click on

#LI-KS1

#LI-Hybrid

title: Data Analyst Logistics
description:
Together, we move the world—we’ve been doing it for over 100 years. As a leading international development partner and systems supplier to the automotive industry, we are passionate about developing innovative solutions for the mobility of tomorrow. Join our MAHLE team! #StrongerTogether

Your role & responsibilities:
• Data modeling with the aim of creating detailed process models for logistical purposes (material movement analysis, dynamic parametrization)
• Data analysis in process mining software to identify process efficiencies and their causes
• Carry out data processing and analysis including statistical modeling techniques
• Derivation of optimization, standardization, and automation measures
• Preparation of results, reporting, and presentation in English
• Help with the design, development, evaluation and monitoring of predictive models and advanced algorithms that help our corporate logistic function to drive decisions
• Work closely with Digital Automation Specialist... Green Belts, business partners and IT analytics teams to evaluate new and alternate data sources as well as computing paradigms and analytical tools
• Participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement models/algorithms in production systems
• Develop metrics providing detailed insight into daily status of operations
• Develop best practice big data and process mining solutions
• Support our logistic function analyzing processes to create a solution design for the technical implementation
• Responsible for the quality assured implementation of data science solutions
• Ensure replication with consistency of data science solutions

Your skills & strengths:
• Fluency in English
• Relevant experience in working with process mining software (e.g., Celonis), good database knowledge as well as knowledge of database-related languages (e.g., SQL)
• Ability to explain complex statistical models and analysis to drive business ideas
• Expertise with common statistical modeling techniques such as time series analysis, linear regression, logistic regression, survival analysis, tree models, cluster analysis, machine learning, customer analytics, digital marketing, or similar domains.
• Higher education
• Knowledge of SAP ERP systems is a major plus
• Working experience with logistical processes is also a major plus
• Good communication and organizational skills
• Self-motivated, customer-oriented and detail-oriented
• Ability to define problems, collect information, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
• Ability to interpret an extensive variety of process related information in mathematical and/or graphical form
• Process modelling skills are a plus
• Green Belt certification is a plus

See what we can offer you!
• Attractive salary package (incl. private medical care, Multisport, group insurance, Edenred prepaid cards)
• Becoming a member of a fast-growing team in an innovative company with a stable market position
• Possibility to work for a well-known brand, a leader in the Automotive industry whose products are highly recognized worldwide
• Relocation bonus for candidates who are based more than 100 km from Wrocław
• Online foreign language courses
• Referral bonus program
• Flexible work schedule

title: Procurement Data Analyst
description:
01/10/2021

Danish Crown Group Functions

POL-Kraków

Procurement Data Analyst

Become part of a global purchasing department

You will be part of a global purchasing department with approximately 50 motivated colleagues.

We are in the process of centralizing procurement for the entire Danish Crown group so that our owners, the farmers, can get more money for their meat. Of this, about 650 mDKK comes from savings within purchases to our approximately 50 factories across Europe and Asia.

To achieve the target, we are transforming procurement. Do you want to join our journey? Would you like to contribute to a transformation where we centralize procurement in the Danish Crown group?

Does optimizing procurement across 7 business units sound like an exciting challenge? And do you want to try yourself in a global company, which among other things has more than 20,000 employees, a turnover of over 30 bPLN. and is Europe's largest meat processing company?

Then you have a rare opportunity... for personal growth and really be an important part of a team who is setting their footprint for the future.

Procurement Data Analyst

Area of responsibility
• Cooperates with Buyers, Category Managers and Reporting Analytics Team
• Deal with Procurement Category for specific inquiries and needs
• Provide support for selected team's activities including small projects management
• Delivers high quality, professional and proactive day to day service

Specific tasks
• Extensive data analysis, data mapping,functional and technical business analysis experience
• Resolve issues and queries, e.g. invoice vs order price variances,
• Create periodical reports and ad-hoc analysis requested by Procurement Category
• Identifies continuous improvement opportunities

Educational background & skills
• University diploma
• Strong command of spoken and written English language
• Excellent Excel & VBA skills, Power Query, Power BI
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Relevant experience
• Understanding of procurement processes
• Knowledge of SAP BI or equivalent reporting tool
• Experience in BPO or SSC procurement organization
• Previous experience with e-procurement systems and Contract Management tools will be an asset

We offer
• Private medical care together with dental care
• Flexible working hours
• Life insurance
• MyBenefit and multisport program
• 2 additional holiday days benefits
• Events, integrations for employees

title: Senior Data Analyst, Platform
description:
Your daily adventures will include:

Define product goals (KPIs), build data models and craft product dashboards.

Design A/B experiments, analyse the results, and provide decision recommendations.

Collaborate with stakeholders (Analysts, PMs, Engs) from other teams and advise them on how to leverage Platform’s data.

Write clear and concise reports of your analyses and educate relevant stakeholders about your findings

Estimate ROI of product initiatives, contribute to product roadmaps and help define requirements for engineers.

Explore data from multiple sources and help understand how products are used and guide the product development process.

We are looking for:

Strong SQL and Python or R skills.

Clear understanding of statistical modelling and experimental design.

Ability to transform large scale data analysis into interpretable, easy to understand action points.

Proactive attitude, sense of ownership and ability to work autonomously.

Experience with BI and data... visualization tools (Looker, Mixpanel, Tableau, etc).

Fluent in English.

You will get extra credits for:

Experience in one or more of the following domains: Geo (Routing, Positioning, Maps, Places), Identity (KYC, Identity fraud), Communications (Chat, NLP, VoiP).

Experience in building products in a startup or tech / product company.

Practical experience with Machine Learning frameworks.

Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.

Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.

Make your mark at one of the fastest-growing organisations in Europe.

Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.

Accelerate your professional growth and enjoy unique career opportunities.

Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.

Enjoy health care coverage, extra vacation days, and plenty of other perks to help you be the best you

title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Finance
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst, Finance
Job ID
97787
Posted
15-Dec-2022
Service line
Corporate Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Data & Analytics
Location(s)
Warsaw - Mazowieckie - Poland
The Role
+ You will be a key member of the EMEA Reporting Centre of Excellence – part of the global organisation providing insights to finance and business stakeholders through reporting, analytics and visualization using best-in class solutions,
+ Responsible for the delivery of end to end business intelligence and reporting projects: from understanding Clients’ needs, requirements gathering through data sourcing, data discovery, dashboard wireframing and managing dashboard development by Business Intelligence experts, presentation to the Clients and hyper care and on-going support after the delivery
+ You propose initiatives for improvements, advanced analytics, data visualization and analytics

1. Responsible for BI projects in various Lines of Business
a... Understanding project needs and value drivers
b. Collect Client requirements in terms of data and analytics and translate it into:
i. Data discovery
ii. Dashboard Wireframing
iii. Presentation of results
c. First point of contact to the Client in terms of data, business analytics
2. Collaboration with EMEA Reporting CoE Experts
3. Setting standard procedures for BI, data governance services:
4. Alignment with Global CoE Structures
Requirements:
+ Fluent English in speaking and writing is a must
+ Ability to communicate with various stakeholders to gain requirements and gather information need to deliver business intelligence projects
+ Ability to present insights to a variety of different audiences (experts, directors, executives, etc.) - to explain complex matters in a simple way
+ Demonstrated ability to learn new tools, systems and processes quickly
+ Excellent analytical and visualization skills
+ Attention to details with a strong focus on accuracy, data validation and data integrity
+ Focused on getting things done
+ Organized, able to work independently and effectively manage workload
+ Highly self-motivated and showing initiative, flexible and collaborative
+ Responsible and mature attitude (responsibility for the managed reporting projects)
· A creative thinker and a problem-solver
DESIRABLE:
+ Professional experience in using Business Intelligence tools -PowerBI preferred,
+ Knowledge of Alteryx
+ Programming experience in Python and SQL
+ Finance business acumen
+ Commercial Real Estate knowledge
+ SSC/BSO experience
+ Experience in working with data warehouses, data marts as data sources

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Senior Data Analyst
Miejsce pracy: WarszawaTechnologie, których używamy
Wymagane

Twój zakres obowiązków
• realny wpływ na zarządzanie ryzykiem kredytowym w Banku - wyciąganie z danych informacji i wyczarowanie z nich konkretnych propozycji dla Biznesu
• optymalizacja procesów kredytowych (na każdym etapie współpracy z klientem) w oparciu o wnioski wyciągnięte z danych

• aktywne budowanie kultury danych w organizacji
Nasze wymagania
• masz co najmniej 3-letni trening w myśleniu analitycznym, oparty na doświadczeniach w obszarze ryzyka kredytowego (i nie tylko, doświadczenie w obszarze klienta firmowego będzie dodatkowym atutem)
• nic... co bazodanowe nie jest Ci obce i SQL-em komunikujesz się równie swobodnie, co polskim i angielskim
• potrafisz budować i optymalizować przepływy danych za pomocą narzędzi ETL, dostosowując je do wymagań biznesowych
• jesteś otwarty/-a na różne narzędzia analityczne (Python, a czasem nawet stary dobry Excel)
• potrafisz z danych wszystko wyczytać, a potem to narysować, opowiedzieć i przekonać pozostałych do swoich wniosków i rekomendacji (mile widziane doświadczenie z Power BI i PowerPointem)
• sprawnie organizujesz czas, a projekty kończysz z sukcesem i w terminie
• lubisz dzielić się swoją wiedzą i chętnie pomagasz innym, wyznaczasz nowe standardy działania, potrafisz działać samodzielnie i w zespole
• lubisz kształtować swoje środowisko pracy, z zamiłowania tropisz i eliminujesz nieefektywności (automatyzując, co się da), dbasz o jakość wyników pracy zespołu
• jesteś otwarty/a na zmiany i chętnie podejmujesz nowe wyzwania
Tak organizujemy naszą pracę
Tak pracujemy
• agile
To oferujemy
• zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę
• wewnętrzne programy rozwojowe umożliwiające doskonalenie kompetencji zawodowych
• udział w ciekawych, strategicznych projektach
• zgrany zespół i przyjazną atmosferę
• atrakcyjny system motywacyjny
• pożyczki na cele mieszkaniowe
• ofertę produktową banku na atrakcyjnych warunkach
• prywatną opiekę zdrowotną
• możliwość wyboru spośród bogatej oferty świadczeń pozapłacowych w ramach systemu kafeteryjnego
• ciekawe akcje w ramach programu propagującego zdrowy styl życia „BeHealthy”
• oferta benefitowa zawiera również rozwiązania dla osób z niepełnosprawnością
Benefity
• dofinansowanie zajęć sportowych
• prywatna opieka medyczna
• zniżki na firmowe produkty i usługi

title: Data Analyst
description:
Our Vision

FLYR Labs is focused on the relentless application of advanced and intuitive technologies that help transportation leaders unlock their ultimate potential.

Starting with airlines, we provide the Cirrus Revenue Operating System™ that reshapes how travel and transportation businesses plan their commercial operation. We displace legacy data, forecasting, pricing, and reporting solutions with a single enterprise SaaS platform that leverages the latest advancements in deep learning, cloud computing, and user experience.

Our hyper-accurate contextual forecasts enable the most effective scheduling, marketing, and leadership decisions while directly managing the pricing for billions of dollars worth of product and revenue.

Our data-driven, deep-learning-based methodology enables any airline to truly maximize their revenue and accurately forecast outcomes, even under unprecedented conditions such as COVID-19. To achieve this vision, we’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to... join our leading-edge, enterprise customer implementation team. This team delights new customers throughout the onboarding process, applying best-in-class AI solutions that revolutionize their revenue operations. The Data Analyst will play a key role in ensuring our customers see rapid time-to-value, applying her or his technical expertise to build, implement and maintain complex and performant models.

What will your destination look like at FLYR?
• Influence the strategic evolution of our real-time predictive models that will revolutionize revenue operations for the transportation industry.
• Deploy and iterate on scalable practices for model evolution, evaluation, and productization.
• Engage directly with customers through presentations, ad hoc touch-points, Q&A, and explanation of model performance and behaviors.
• Own responsibility for highly technical tasks and ensure successful project execution.
• Collaborate closely with FLYR’s Data Platform team to communicate opportunities for tool improvements and to share learnings and best practices.
• On-call support during project go-live.

What can you bring on this trip?
• Advanced SQL - You know your way around analytical and aggregate functions, complex joins, window functions, and are confident in wrangling all types of data in SQL.
• Strong Python skills - You are well-versed in common data science libraries such as Pandas and NumPy but are also able to write basic Python code that is clean, well-documented and tested.
• Experience working with large datasets for ETL activities; experience with task orchestration tools like Apache Airflow is a plus.
• You are highly curious and willing to dive into data to uncover the truth and discover actionable insights. You are always asking relevant questions and you know how to find answers within data.
• You are a strong communicator and team player and have experience collaborating across multiple teams and external partners.
• Experience with data visualization (Tableau, Looker, etc.) and cloud computing platforms (GCP, etc.) is a plus.
• You have 3+ years of experience tackling similar problems academically and/or professionally and a proven history of delivering results.

What can we offer you?
• B2B or Regular employment contract
• Flexible working hours
• Hybrid model of work
• Work equipment (macOS, keyboard and mouse)
• Medical care
• Sport card
• Training budget
• Lunches
• Many more!

Our Commitment to Equality

Here at FLYR, we’re committed to growing with intention, having our teams better reflect the world around us. We strive to create an environment of inclusion and even more importantly, belonging, where psychological safety, empathy, and human connection are at the center of our leadership principles. Not only does this enable us to create better products and have a better work environment, it’s good for the bottom line and it’s the right thing to do.

FLYR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetics, marital or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, FLYR complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates

title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)

Jeśli chcesz lub masz doświadczenie w pracy z klientem i wyróżniasz się myśleniem analitycznym – dołącz do nas!Poszukujemy proaktywnej, dobrze zorganizowanej i komunikatywnej osoby, która będzie umiała przełożyć oczekiwania raportowe klienta na konkretne wymagania techniczne. USA, Japonia, Argentyna, RPA, Polska czy Europa Zachodnia)Praca w międzynarodowym środowisku w młodym i dynamicznym zespoleWspółpraca z doświadczonymi konsultantami i ekspertami z obszaru Businesss IntelligenceNowe wyzwania wspierające rozwój zawodowy i podnoszące kwalifikacjeRealny wpływ na rozwój narzędzi do raportowania i produktów Comarch BIDostęp do prywatnej opieki medycznej dla Ciebie i Twojej rodzinyMożliwość pracy zdalnej w modelu hybrydowym (po okresie wdrożenia)Szkolenia onboardingowe adoptujące do nowych obowiązków

title: Senior Data Analyst, CRM Marketing
description:
Your daily adventures will include:

Developing the methodology and playbooks for analyzing the impact of communications; and helping with applications by the team members in analytics and communications teams

Improving users segmentation and targeting

Setting up and analyzing the experiments, proposing and testing hypotheses for driving additional impact from communications

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide reports to make recommendations (e.g. impact analysis, user’s clustering, forecasting)

Working closely on evaluation and improvement of communication and analytical tools with Marketing Technology, Product, and CRM Marketing teams to make sure that we have all the needed functionality for the most impactful communications and impact measurement

Guiding a small team of data analysts

We are looking for:
• Previous experience with working with CRM and/or user lifecycle data analytics
• At least 4 years experience dealing with large volumes... of data as an analyst, statistician or econometrician

Solid grasp of statistics

Extensive experience with A/B testing and other experimentation techniques

Advanced SQL

Strong skills with analysis and modeling in Python or R

Experience with ML frameworks

Experience with causal inference, uplift modeling and other methods relevant for analysis of marketing communications

Good written and verbal communication, fluency in English

You will get extra credits for:

Previous work experience on a similar position in a large company or in an agency

Data Science background

Previous work experience in large customer engagement/communication platforms (think Clevertap, Braze, Leanplum or similar).

Experience with leading mid-to-senior data analysts formally or informally

description:
Our Vision
FLYR Labs is focused on the relentless application of advanced and intuitive technologies that help transportation leaders unlock their ultimate potential.

Starting with airlines, we provide the Cirrus Revenue Operating System™ that reshapes how travel and transportation businesses plan their commercial operation. We displace legacy data, forecasting, pricing, and reporting solutions with a single enterprise SaaS platform that leverages the latest advancements in deep learning, cloud computing, and user experience.

Our hyper-accurate contextual forecasts enable the most effective scheduling, marketing, and leadership decisions while directly managing the pricing for billions of dollars worth of product and revenue.

As a Data Engineer you will be working in a Scrum team consisting of Backend Engineers and Data Analysts focused on delivering data metrics being a source of truth for all our products. You will develop solutions to standardize and automate processes required... for delivery of consistent and reliable data, define quality checks and work on improving the overall testing framework for metrics (including performance and integration tests).

title: Senior Data Analyst, Supply Chain
description:
Your daily adventures will include:

Create processes and methods to gather supply chain data

Measure & report SC KPIs like forecast accuracy, bias, availability, waste, inventory, length out of stock, and supplier OTIF amongst others

Analyze data to identify problematic areas in data analysis and suggest improvements

Production and distribution of daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly reports and dashboards

Preparation of templates for global and local team review meetings Dark Stores supply chain forecast

Take ownership for and continuously improve the supply forecast throughout all our stores globally

Analyze historical trends in order to improve both the purchasing and supply chain forecast - incorporate all important trends such as promotions, seasonality, delivery fees, etc

Improve and deploy all local forecasts worldwide

Work with both HQ and Local teams to design the best forecast & replenishment plans for each market

Serve the different stakeholders with accurate... forecasts in order to make sure we have all needed products

Assist teams in preparation of replenishment forecast for vendors

Analyze historical supplier performance and provide recommendations for improvement in the areas of delivery schedules, inventory management based on supplier reliability, supplier performance dashboards for negotiation

Collaborate and partner with the Central team to ensure our efforts are resourced to maximize positive impact to the overall growth of the business on all fronts

Holistic Inventory Management with processes and tools designed to maintain optimum levels of inventory per category, including ABC analysis, Economic Order Quantity (EOQ) etc

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or related field

At least 2 years of experience in an analytical role dealing with large volumes of data

title: STAFF RISK ANALYST (f/m/d)
description:
Job Description Summary
As part of the Security Risk and Compliance organization, you will be responsible for ensuring we meet our obligations to protect the privacy and security of individually identifiable data that we collect, process, or store while acting on behalf of our customers, who are healthcare providers.
This role provides an opportunity to use your data analytical skills to improve the organization’s data governance efforts. It requires an understanding of privacy principles, ability to understand or familiarity with GEHC’s data collection and ingestion processes, analytical and technical capabilities to perform the compliance analysis of datasets, related scripts and supporting documents. The Staff Risk Analyst will form an authorized view on the appropriateness of the data collection process.
In addition, the Staff Risk Analyst will be responsible for collaboration with the respective teams - incl. other privacy groups, legal councils, technology, security, service... product and functional teams - to ensure procedures and access to personal information / patient health information processed by the organization are in compliance with contractual, regulatory (global, regional, local) and sector specific (the healthcare organization) information privacy practices.
Job Description
Essential Responsibilities:
+ Be the primary owner of high impact work - Perform the formal compliance analysis and assessment of data ingestion processes to ensure they are in line with the organization’s role to support the service activity, while minimizing the data privacy risk related to our customers’ data.
+ Work with data sets to enhance our security, privacy posture – Review, analyze and assess datasets, understand the data collection rules and process - that might include the interpretation of the scripts and reviewing the code - to derive key insights.
+ Work with our internal stakeholders - Work collaboratively with the privacy legal teams, technology, security, service, product and functional teams during the evaluation process, data analysis and reporting. Provide privacy risk evaluation to leadership and recommendations based on the identified issues. Monitor the remediation activities until implemented to reduce the risk to appropriate level
+ Improve our processes, data pipelines or data feeds - Support the definition and implementation of the data governance framework with reviews of systems and / or processes to identify privacy related risks and requirements, with enhanced focus on data lake ingestion and egress processes. Support Data Privacy related audit engagements/queries - provide input for GDPR, HIPAA and other regional privacy framework related activities. Participate in cross business security and privacy initiatives and maintain relationships as appropriate
+ Qualifications / Requirements:
+ BS Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent
+ Minimum two years IT/Security/Data analytics/Code development experience or 2 or more years of experience working with the data privacy domain / information security specific to data protection
+ Experience with advanced analytics, data analysis
+ Experience/Exposure to the following technologies/tools/scripting languages: Perl, Python, Shell or Batch languages
+ Understanding of IT technologies, standards and how to apply them
+ Experience working with product development teams on product security
+ Strong attention to detail
+ Methodical problem solver
+ Coordinate efforts in line with the "bigger picture" to maximize the overall value of IT service delivery and demonstrated history resolving conflicts in priority
+ Awareness of and ability to deliver compliance requirements
+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to interface and influence at all levels in the organization
+ Excellent interpersonal, presentation and facilitation skills
+ Demonstrated ability to excel in a global matrix organization
+ Ability to learn complex systems and business processes and define requirements for solutions
+ Understanding of international privacy and legal regulations
+ Ability to prioritize work to meet tight deadlines
+ Experience working with healthcare specific legal and regulatory requirements
Desired Characteristics:
+ Familiarity with product development methodology ensuring security (DEPS)
+ Experience in the fields of product security, service, engineering – any modality
+ One or more Security Certifications (CISSP, etc.)
+ Expertise in SQL for data manipulation, profiling, analysis, and extraction
+ Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL)
+ Experience in:
+ Microsoft PowerBI and Tableau
+ Machine Learning/Predictive Analytics
+ Experience working with audit and assessment frameworks
About GE Healthcare
GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator with over 100 years of healthcare industry experience and around 50,000 employees globally. We enable clinicians to make faster, more informed decisions through intelligent devices, data analytics, applications and services, supported by our Edison intelligence platform. We operate at the center of an ecosystem working toward precision health - digitizing healthcare, helping drive productivity and improving outcomes for patients, providers, health systems and researchers around the world.
Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
GE Healthcare - every moment matters

title: HR Analyst (Intern)
description:
Grid Dynamics is currently looking for an HR Analyst Intern who will be responsible for capturing, analyzing, and reporting operational and HR data

Responsibilities:

• Build, interpret, and present key metrics reports In Google sheets/Excel and Google slides/PowerPoint presentations
• Data quality assurance (monitoring and prevention of data inaccuracy)
• Ad-hoc requests from the supervisor
• Identify areas for data collection improvement and participate in continuous improvement initiatives

Requirements:

• Analytical thinking
• Knowledge of MS Excel (logical formulas, Pivot tables, etc.) and/or Google Query, PowerPoint
• Attention to detail and accuracy
• Upper-Intermediate English (written and oral)
• Ability and willingness to learn in a highly dynamic environment

Will be a plus:
• Specific knowledge of the software we use (or are going to) for data processing & analysis: Google Query, SuperSet
• Knowledge of SQL, BI tools
• Experience in data analysis & reporting and/or Data... visualization
• Experience with HR software

We offer:• Work in global HR function with many different locations
• Participation in challenging projects, an opportunity for professional development and growth
• Flexible working hours and a dynamic environment
• Friendly cooperative team and atmosphere

About us:

Grid Dynamics is an engineering services company known for transformative, mission-critical cloud solutions for retail, finance, and technology sectors. We have architected some of the busiest e-commerce services on the Internet and have never had an outage during the peak season. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Ramon, California with offices throughout the US and Eastern Europe, we focus on big data analytics, scalable omnichannel services, DevOps, and cloud enablement

title: Senior Solution Analyst- GAMMA Retail Catalyst
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Sr. Analyst for the GAMMA Retail Catalyst product will play a critical role in delivering, implementing, and supporting BCG's client-facing software solutions – independently taking direction from and guiding strategic approach with senior business leaders in our Retail and Pricing sectors as well as the Product Managers for GAMMA Retail Catalyst, AIR, and other GAMMA product teams. Key activities will include gathering requirements from internal and external clients, advising them on the application's usage best practices, and recommending processes to optimize the business value delivered by the application; then sourcing and preparing data, managing required client processes changes, overseeing deployment by setting up and configuring the application according to the requirements, and training client's end users. The Analyst will interact directly with both BCG case team members and clients and must understand and be able to navigate the clients' data and... requirements. He or she should be able to quickly learn methodologies and approaches used in GAMMA Retail Catalyst, understand the industry / client context, and learn analytical approaches used to transform data into business insights. The Analyst should also be able to work with the BCG team and clients to co-create new approaches for further development of software solutions. On the solution deployment side he or she must be able to determine what is needed for compliance with the client's business needs, security policies, deployment, and support, and leverage the right tools and resources to complete the implementation with the highest level of customer satisfaction. When confronted with technical challenges, he or she must work with the BCG platform team and (working together) find creative, economical, and scalable solutions within the application's technical specifications.
YOU'RE GOOD AT

Client Requirements, Business Processes Change, Data and Analytics Management, Application Setup
• Works together with the BCG client team and the Retailer (either, the “customer”) to understand client's processes, business requirements, and data structure / challenges
• Responds to customer inquiries and requests: Troubleshooting, system configurations, service issues
• Demonstrates a proactive, solution-based approach to enhance client relations via meetings, calls, emails, and chat
• Constructs and manages the implementation project plan with customer counterpart, including setting and managing customer expectations based on the current state of product offerings and services
• Identifies required changes in client's business processes and supports process change management
• Understands client's data situation, develops blueprint for future state data management and works on implementation of new data processes
• Performs analysis of client data to determine parameter requirements for application's setup, including ETL and processing of data, as needed
• Works with the Data Engineering, DevOps, and Product teams to implement requirements
Application Delivery, Implementation, Training, and Support
• Leads and oversees deployment of the software, configures the software to client's needs
• Provides guidance to BCG case teams, client's business users and IT team to enable them to roll out, operate, monitor, and maintain the application
• Collaborates with GAMMA Retail Catalyst technical teams, application software vendors and other resources to diagnose and resolve application's technical and/or non-technical problems, bugs, performance, and other issues
• Collaborates with internal colleagues to construct appropriate training and support plans for the continuation of the customer’s users and deliverables after the implementation goes into production
• Works on development of application user guides and other application related materials
• Documents, tracks, and monitors application's bugs, problems, and issues to ensure timely resolution
• Performs quality control tests and keeps logs of problems, issues, changes, and future enhancements
• Tracks project progress against agreed to KPIs and any contractual obligations
• Provides product feedback to development teams
Other
• Performs other projects and duties as assigned or required
• Ability to travel up to 80% in a given week for periods of time depending on the supported products and implementation/support requirements

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
• Deep experience in brick-and-mortar Retail organizations (e.g. merchandizing, pricing, analytics, etc.)
• Advanced degree with strong academic achievements in business management, engineering, mathematics or similar
• Experience in areas such as data and / or analytics-related work, data management, end user training on data management / insights generation from data / software applications, end user support, or related activities
• Preferred customer support experience in a SaaS environment or technology industry
• Knowledge in the following fields, technologies, and tools:
• Skills in interpreting data and generating business insights from data
• Interest and ability to learn data management tools such as Alteryx, SQL, DataIKU, etc.
• Knowledge of R-script and/or Python
• MS Excel
• MS PowerPoint

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.
Key Competencies
Customer and business focus
• A passion for customer success and support is essential
• Interest in Technology and being able to learn quickly regarding tech-heavy topics and tools
• Able to adjust approach to effectively interact with customers at all organizational and technical levels
• Focus on excellent customer service and user needs; willingness to go above and beyond to deliver results
• Able to confidently make decisions and escalate issues and decisions when appropriate
• Flexibility and openness to ask for help when needed
Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Fluent written and spoken English
• Able and willing to give and receive honest, balanced feedback
Problem solving, analytical skills and decision making
• Bright, ambitious, solution-oriented self-starter
• Able to effectively handle difficult and stressful situations with poise, tact and patience, while demonstrating a sense of urgency
• Able to anticipate, identify, and solve critical problems
• Flexible, self-motivated, and proactive out-of-the-box and critical thinker
Work management, organization and planning
• Excellent organizational skills with strong attention to detail; efficient time management; able to prioritize work effectively
• Independently and proactively communicates issues, priorities, and objectives
• Able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, demanding environment
Values and ethics
• Demonstrates competence and character that inspires trust
• Ability to respect all BCG and client information as personal and confidential
Work environment
• Able to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment and to interpret rules and guidelines flexibly to enhance the business in keeping with BCG’s values and culture
• The ideal candidate must understand that client demands aren't always between 9-5pm and be available / flexible where necessary
• Experience working successfully within a complex matrix structured organization
• Able to understand and manage complex reporting relationships and incorporate multiple labor laws and cultures

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data EngineerMiejsce pracy: PoznańTechnologies we useExpected
• AWS
• Data Lake
• AWS Glue
• Python
• ETL
About the project

In this position, you will support a pharmaceutical company responsible for the life and health of over 15 million patients in the world. The data engineers in this particular long-term project will be responsible for the data onboarding and hence custom integration work in a multicultural agile team.
Your responsibilities
• Building different connectors such as FTP, API, or JDBC integrations
• Making the data available in the data lake through AWS Glue, Appflow, and Lake Formation
• Monitoring the quality of the overall onboarding processes
• Writing unit/data tests
• Provide clean data sets to end users
• Modeling data in a way that empowers users to answer their own questions
• Transforming, testing, deploying, and documenting data
• Appling software engineering best practices, such as version control and continuous integration, to the analytics code base
Our... requirements
• 4+ years of experience working with programming languages focused on data pipelines, eg. Python or R
• 4+ years of experience working with SQL
• 3+ years of experience in data pipelines maintenance
• 3+ years of experience with different types of storage (filesystem, relation, MPP, NoSQL) and working with various kinds of data (structured, unstructured, metrics, logs, etc.)
• 3+ years of experience in working in data architecture concepts (in any of the following areas: data modeling, metadata management, workflow management, ETL/ELT, real-time streaming, data quality, distributed systems)
• 3+ years of cloud technologies with emphasis on data pipelines (Airflow, Glue, Dataflow, and other smart solutions for handling data in the cloud, such as Elastic, Redshift, Bigquery, Lambda, s3, EBS, etc.)
• Excellent knowledge of Git, Gitflow, and DevOps tools (e.g. Docker, Bamboo, Jenkins, Terraform)
What we offer
• First place in Great Place to Work ranking in 2021 – we receive the title and implement new ideas thanks to our employees opinions
• Dozens of fascinating projects for prestigious brands from all over the world – you can change them thanks to Job Changer application
• Employment stability – revenue of 1 MLD PLN, no debts, preferred supplier status for many clients
• Fantastic atmosphere created by all Sii Power People
• Investment in your growth – meetups, webinars, training platform and technology blog – you choose
• PLN 500 000 per year for your ideas – with this amount, we support the passions and voluntary actions of our workers
• Attractive benefits package – private healthcare, MyBenefit platform, car discounts and more
• Comfortable workplace – class A offices or remote work
Recruitment stages
• Send your CV
• Talk to us about your expectations
• Learn more about our projects and choose the best
• Start your adventure with Sii

title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Growth
description:
Your daily adventures will include:

Develop business reports and dashboards for Growth Analytics team

Perform data analysis by writing SQL queries to answer ad-hoc business questions and provide insights on customer base, marketplace balance, growth metrics for our team

Suggest new metrics, tools, processes for our reporting to ensure consistency and reliability of data-driven decision-making across the organization

Work with cross-teams to audit the definitions of business metrics and accuracy of data, improve data model and data pipelines

Implement appropriate solutions for improving data availability and load times e.g., caching query data, persisting tables, etc

Support Data Engineers in migration to Data Lake to decrease data latency in reporting

We are looking for:

1+ years of experience in Business analytics, marketing, data visualization, data modeling, information systems, computer science, data engineering or closely related fields.

Passion for understanding the... business needs and processes, visualization of business insights and automation of BI needs.

Experience with the majority of the following skills and tools: SQL, Looker / PowerBI / Tableau, R, Python, Advanced Excel, Excel Macros, Airflow, Databricks, Data Modeling.

Amazing attention to details and high self-organization + awesome visualization skills.

Ability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders and work collaboratively with team members from different backgrounds.

You will get extra credits for:

Experience in gathering the business needs and developing the C-level reporting.

Experience in designing data models, ETL and data pipelines

Automation of reporting in google-sheets.

1-3 years experience with Looker: LookML models development, looks, and dashboards.

Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.

Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.

Make your mark at one of the fastest-growing organisations in Europe.

Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.

Accelerate your professional growth and enjoy unique career opportunities.

Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.

Enjoy health care coverage, extra vacation days, and plenty of other perks to help you be the best you

title: Senior Financial Analyst
via: via Careers At Warner Bros. Discovery
description:
Overview:

FP&A COE is known for its innovative thinking, best practices implementation and great customer service. Warner Bros. Discovery seeks to unlock value for the company through igniting curiosity in all of its team members, encouraging collaboration and constantly transforming the way we work.

The Senior Financial Analyst will understand reporting deliverable schedules and do the heavy lift of all report and supporting file preparation (e.g., daily/weekly/monthly, incl. rolling of schedules) prepared by the Subscriber Reporting group. Perform self-review and ensure reporting metrics and financial dashboard summaries highlighting significant business trends is delivered timely and accurately to Reporting Manager for review.

You will partake in daily calls with Data Insights and the Business Intelligence Data Pipeline teams to speak to the reconciliation of the data driven from daily power queries (Finance based reports) and Data Insights reports (Looker), understand data... discrepancies and issues that need to be presented back to team for next steps.

As preparer and user of the reporting data, understand how to take business considerations needs into reportable action. You will proactively identify process inefficiencies and opportunities. Play a role in testing of reporting related projects and tasks within the DSR team.
Responsibilities:
• Preparation/Review of weekly global reporting metrics (Paid Subscriber balances & movements, Churn %, ARPU, etc.) and financial dashboard summaries highlighting significant business trends and financial results, by leveraging the BI created data analytics dashboards (e.g., Looker) and existing built reports from the data warehouse (e.g., Zeppelin and Snowflake) to provide accurate subscriber reporting that are distributed to various finance departments (Planning, etc.) and HBO Max department leads
• Participate in the daily run of key subscriber reporting metrics (e.g., including subscriber acquisitions, conversions, reconnects and churn) used for reporting per plan offerings and participate in daily calls with Data Insights to review reporting data
• Prepare all Promotional and Bounty reporting as it relates to subscriber metrics and contract and performance obligations
• Participate in Reports reconciliations and analysis as needed (e.g., new initiatives for HBO Max; New IAP Partner reporting data; etc.)
• Understand the reporting deliverable schedules of the weekly reporting metrics and financial dashboard summaries
Qualifications:
• Minimum 3 years relevant work experience. Entertainment industry and / or multinational business experience is a plus
• Solid analytical, technical, organizational and interpersonal skills
• Problem solver with ability to manage details
• Proven ability to set and meet realistic deadlines and achieve successful results
• Excellent oral, written communication skills, and financial presentation skills
• Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritize and adhere to strict deadlines
• Self-motivated individual, detail-oriented with ability to work independently and collaboratively
• Strong Microsoft package skills a must (particularly Excel and PowerPoint)
• BS in Accounting, Finance or Computer Science
• CPA or BI certification is a plus

What's in it for you?
• Hybrid work model, flexible working hours
• Free access to player.pl
• Benefit package: private medical health care, life insurance, MyBenefit cafeteria including sport card, social funds, retirement pension plans, recognition platform, employee referral program
• Work-life balance initiatives: wellbeing platform, yoga, educational webinars, Employee Assistance Program, internal media initiatives
• Training & development: sharing the cost of English lessons, Employee Resource Groups, Bridge learning platform, sharing sessions with experts
• CSR activities: volunteering, eco & social initiatives
• Casual dress code
• Parking space available for booking
